title: Linux tcpdump Command with Practical Examples
description: Learn how to use the powerful tcpdump command to capture and analyze network traffic on Linux systems. Discover practical examples and techniques for filtering and monitoring network data.

meta.title: Linux tcpdump Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Learn how to use the powerful tcpdump command to capture and analyze network traffic on Linux systems. Discover practical examples and techniques for filtering and monitoring network data.
meta.keywords: tcpdump, network traffic, packet capture, network analysis, Linux, network monitoring, network troubleshooting

verify.name: Verify tcpdump installation
verify.hint: Ensure that the tcpdump command is installed and available in your system's PATH.

verify.name: Verify network traffic capture
verify.hint: Ensure that you can capture at least one network packet using the tcpdump command.

verify.name: Verify network capture file
verify.hint: Ensure that the network capture file 'network_capture.pcap' is created in the current directory.

verify.name: Verify HTTP traffic capture
verify.hint: Ensure that you can capture at least one HTTP packet using the tcpdump command with the 'tcp port 80' filter.

verify.name: Verify IP address filtering
verify.hint: Ensure that you can capture at least one packet for the IP address 172.17.0.2 using the tcpdump command with the 'host' filter.
